cause.description:
Aortic dissection is commonly misdiagnosed and therefore undetected. If not diagnosed and surgically repaired quickly, it is almost always fatal. Symptoms are similar to heart attack: chest pain, ripping/tearing sensation, numbness in arms/legs, clammy feeling, enlarged heart, high blood pressure (which could also be a cause).
1. Health professionals must be better educated about the condition.
2. Health professionals should not rule out a diagnosis based on the patient's age.
3. Patients must be proactive and demand a CT scan if other diagnoses have been ruled out.
cause.mission: To create awareness about this potentially fatal condition that claimed my 24 year old brother Steve's life January 10, 2000
cause.name: Aortic Dissection Awareness
